moves.1. c4 e5 2. e3 Nf6 3. d4 exd4 4. exd4 Bb: It's just like fighting the Sicilian with white... d4 came to early...
moves.5. Nc3 d5 6. a3 Bxc3+ 7. bxc3: So far, so good... The English fortress is a mess...
moves.7... O-O 8. Nf3: 8. Bd3 Re8+ 9. Ne2, is of course better... Now pawn c4 gets lost... However, after 8. ... c5! 9. Ne2 (dxc5, Be6!) cxd4 10. cxd4 dxc4 11. Bxc4 Nc6, all is well for black...
moves.9... dxc4: One white Sicilian pawn, missing in action... Where's the mob?
moves.11. a4 c6 12. Qc2 Bg4 13. Bg5 Qd6: Via clear threats, black has gained a firm position. Logical now, seems 14. Bxf6 Qxf6 15. Ne5 Bxe2 16. Qxe2 Qe6...
moves.14. Ra2: Extra coverage for Be2. It won't work...
moves.15. Rb2: Out of order... Whites position screams Be3, and release the tension on Be2, followed by Bh5...
moves.15... a6 16. axb5 cxb5 17. Bh4: This was not in whites best interrest. Better was 16. Bh4...
moves.19. Rc1 Nc6: I didn't like the idea of 19. ... Bg6 20. Qd2 b4 21. Bd6!.. We complete development, and Be2 stays a burdon for white...
moves.20. Ra2: No better is 20. Bf1 Bxf3 21. gxf3 Qe7 22. f4 b4...
Maybe 23. c4? After 23. ... Rxe2 24. Rxe2 Bxf3 25. gxf3 Nxd4...
moves.23... Na5 24. Bd1: No relief in 24. Ra1 Nxc3! 25. Rxa5 Nxe2 26. Ra1 Bxf3 27. gxf3 Nxd4 28. Rxa6 Rc2!
moves.24... b4 25. Bxb3: 25. Rxb3 Nxb3 26. Bxb3 Rxc3 27. Rxc3 Nxc3...
moves.25... Rxc3: Without further adue... We threaten Bxf3, as well as Nxb3
moves.26. Rcb1 Nxb3 27. Rb2xb3 Rxb3 28. Rxb3 a: It is hard, to find moves for white... This prevents 29. ... a4, for now... 29. Rb2/Rb1 Bxf3...
moves.29... Rd8 30. Bc5 a4 31. Rb2: More resiliant is 31. Rb1 Bxf3 22. gxf3 Ra8 23. Ra1...
moves.32. Ra2: No excuses left. All other rook moves lead to the same variation...
moves.32... Bxf3 33. gxf3 b3 34. Rxa3 Rb8: White resigns. This win brought me at 1994, sadly I could not hold it up...
